item.title: Social Expert (Category II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Final Evaluation of Community Development Programme Phase 4 (CDP-4)

The overall objective of CDP-4 is to reduce poverty in Kenya through empowering communities to initiate and implement community-based socio-economic infrastructure and environmental projects subsequently leading to better governance at the local, district, county and national levels. The CDP-4 purpose is to support and mainstream community-led approaches to poverty reduction and sustainable management of natural resources by communities in rural and peri-urban areas across Kenya.

Social Expert (Category II)

  • Minimum of first degree in Agriculture, Sociology or any other relevant social science
  • Experience in project cycle management, participatory planning, capacity building and monitoring and evaluation;
  • Experience in inclusion of cross cutting issues such as gender, good governance, environmental conservation, HIV/AIDS, vulnerable groups in project design and implementation;
  • Experience with community mobilization, participation and involvement.
  • Experience in project design, budgeting, and Logical Framework development
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in implementation of community-based programmes in Kenya or East African countries.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Ecologist/Environmental Management Expert (Category I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Final Evaluation of Community Development Programme Phase 4 (CDP-4)

The overall objective of CDP-4 is to reduce poverty in Kenya through empowering communities to initiate and implement community-based socio-economic infrastructure and environmental projects subsequently leading to better governance at the local, district, county and national levels. The CDP-4 purpose is to support and mainstream community-led approaches to poverty reduction and sustainable management of natural resources by communities in rural and peri-urban areas across Kenya.

Senior Ecologist/Environmental Management Expert (Category I)

  • Minimum of first degree in Ecology or Environmental Planning, Science and Community Development
  • At least 5 years' experience in team leadership;
  • Experience in undertaking Environmental Impact Assessments (EIA) and/or Environmental Audit (EA) and Strategic Environmental Assessments (SEAs);
  • Experience in climate change and renewable energy projects;
  • Recognized and/or registered by relevant professional bodies at national, regional and international levels.
  • Experience in the application of the ecosystem approach
  • Experience in project design, budgeting, and Logical Framework development;
  • Minimum of 12 years' experience in conducting EIA/EA studies for community-based projects.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Trade Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to the Government of Seychelles on the implementation of the IRPA process

The overall objective of the assignment is to assist Government in its efforts of deepening regional integration through an enhanced competitiveness of both state (ministries/departments/agencies) and private sector operators, in line with the provisions made under the iEPA.

Senior Trade Expert (Expert 3)

  • Master’s degree in International Trade with a specialisation in private sector development. In absence of a Master’s degree, equivalent professional experience for at least 15 years in the sector(s) directly related to economic development domains related to the assignment
  • Strong and specific experience of at least 10 years in private sector development;
  • Knowledge of social, economic and financial considerations associated with the marketing of business development services in developing countries;
  • Experience in preparing business plans would be an asset;
  • At least 5 years of professional experience in developing countries, preferably in design development and implementation of projects in business development services and competitiveness;
  • Sound expertise in issues related to setting up business incubators, preferably gained in a emerging/ developing island states country environment;
  • Having drafted at least two feasibility and/or business plans for business incubators;
  • Working experience in Africa and in particular the Republic of Seychelles
  • English Language
  • French Language an asset

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

*WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS *

item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to the Government of Seychelles on the implementation of the IRPA Process

The overall objective of the assignment is to assist Government in its efforts of deepening regional integration through an enhanced competitiveness of both state (ministries/departments/agencies) and private sector operators, in line with the provisions made under the iEPA.

Institutional & Legal Expert (Expert 2)

  • Master’s degree in Economics, Law or related fields. In absence of a Master’s degree, equivalent professional experience for at least 15 years in the sector(s) directly related to economic development domains related to the assignment.
  • At least 12 years' experience in development economics, regional integration, trade agreements, project formulation/implementation in developing countries;
  • At least 12 years' experience in institutional and regulatory and legal frameworks;
  • At least 6 years' experience in ACP countries;
  • Experience with projects using innovative financial instruments and blending of funds will be an advantage.

item.title: Senior Development Economist with a Specialisation in International Trade (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to the Government of Seychelles on the implementation of the IRPA Process

The overall objective of the assignment is to assist Government in its efforts of deepening regional integration through an enhanced competitiveness of both state (ministries/departments/agencies) and private sector operators, in line with the provisions made under the iEPA.

Senior Development Economist with a Specialisation in International Trade (TL)

  • At least a Master’s Degree in Development Economics with a specialisation and/or a strong focus on international trade, or similar discipline of relevance to the assignment. In the absence of a master’s degree, professional experience of at least 15 years in the sector(s) directly related to trade development domains related to this assignment.

Specific experience:

  • At least 12 years' working experience in undertaking diagnostic trade integration studies, trade agreements, policies and issues;
  • At least 12 years' working experience in the strategic planning and design /formulation of trade/regional integration projects;
  • Experience of at least 6 years in the implementation of trade or regional integration projects in developing countries, including ACP countries;
  • At least 4 years' experience on EPA matters, either in terms of project formulation/implementation or in advisory capacity. The candidate should be fully conversant with the EPA process;
  • Experience in coordination and team leader positions in at least 2 projects; and have demonstrated experience in the provision of technical assistance in relation to trade negotiation and/or facilitation;
  • Experience with international donors and/or financial institutions;
  • A professional experience working with the Seychelles will be an advantage.
  • English Language
  • French Language an asset

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

item.title: KE 3 & 4 – Agricultural & Rural Development Experts
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Evaluation of Sudan Food Security Programme - Rural Smallholder Component

The main objective of the evaluation are to provide the relevant external co-operation services of the European Union, the partner government and, when appropriate, the wider public with:

  • An overall independent assessment of the past performance of the intervention;
  • Key lessons and recommendations

*KE 3 & 4 – Agricultural & Rural Development Experts (25w/d each, Cat III) *

  • A post graduate degree in agriculture, rural development, food security or a related discipline with speciality focus-areas of one or more of the following: agronomy, research & extension, horticulture, fisheries and agricultural value chains;
  • Proven expertise of at least 3 years in Sudan working in agriculture, rural development or food security sectors (including at least two or more of the speciality focus-areas mentioned above); • Proven expertise in monitoring, evaluation and reporting in the agriculture, rural development or food security sectors; • Good knowledge of project cycle management; • Excellent verbal and written Arabic and English; • Understanding and knowledge of the management, coordination and/or supervision of projects implemented by Non-Governmental Organisations (NGOs)will be an asset; • Understanding and Knowledge of the implementation of EU-funded projects/programmes;

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

item.title: Junior Expert in Development Cooperation
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
EU-Ghana Cooperation: EU Joint Programming Phase II

The main objective of the assignment is to facilitate the task of the EU Development Partners involved in Joint Programming in Ghana of preparing the next Phase 2017-2020.

Junior Expert in Development Cooperation 69 w/d:

  • Master’s degree in international development, economics, finance, business and related fields or, in its absence, equivalent professional experience in related discipline of at least 2 years in addition to the requested general professional experience;
  • At least 3 years’ experience in the area of development cooperation;
  • Demonstrated solid knowledge and experience in development planning, donor coordination, monitoring and evaluation, whereby solid knowledge could be demonstrated by having successfully undertaken at least 2 assignments in the above mentioned areas over the last 3 years (2012-2015);
  • Previous experience in EU Joint Programming processes is considered and advantage;
  • Significant experience in development project identification and formulation, whereby significant experience could be demonstrated by having undertaken at least 2 assignments for Development Partners over the last 3 years (2012-2015);
  • Knowledge of sub-Saharan region desirable: experience in West Africa is considered an advantage
  • Fluency in both written and spoken English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

item.title: Expert Junior – Logisticien/Securité
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mobilisazion d'une assistance technique pour l'elaboration d'une cartographie detaillee de la societe civile du Burkina Faso

L’étude contribuera a la mise en œuvre de la stratégie d’appui aux OSC dans le cadre de la Feuille de Route (FdR) sur l’engagement envers la société civile établie par le Group UE + pour la période 2014-2017.

Expert junior –logisticien/securité (80h/j, Categorie II):

  • Diplôme d’études supérieures BAC+3 ans ou équivalent
  • Au moins 3 ans d’expérience avec une ONG dans la gestion logistique de projets humanitaires ou de développement
  • Très bonne connaissance du terrain au Burkina Faso
  • Capacité de travailler de manière autonome
  • Bonne connaissance de protocoles et procédures de sécurité

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

item.title: Two experts in Election and Parliamentary Reform (Cat I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The global objective is to assist the EU Delegation in the preparation of detailed designs of two programmes 2017-2020 in support of democratisation: 1) electoral reforms, and 2) parliamentary reforms.

The specific objectives are:

  • Study the sectors context, conduct stakeholder analysis and assess feasibility.
  • Conduct multi-stakeholder consultations to obtain a consensus and good level of ownership from all relevant counterparts for the future programmes.
  • Advise on possible modalities of assistance acceptable to beneficiaries.
  • Develop full set of draft programming documents required for the project identification, formulation and contracting for two programmes (1. electoral reforms, and 2. parliamentary reforms).

Two Experts in Election and Parliamentary Reform (Cat I)

  • Master degree in one or more of the following fields: social or political sciences, law, public administration or any other relevant discipline. If an expert does not hold a master degree, then as an equivalent he must possess the first university degree and 3 years of relevant general professional experience in excess of the 12 years defined below.
  • Each of the experts must possess a minimum of 12 years of professional experience in the sector directly related to the LOT and specifically in democratisation processes, electoral and parliamentary reforms.

  • The two experts need to possess as a minimum a complementary experience and expertise to cover all the following fields:

  • development work in relation to democratisation, electoral reforms, electoral process, election management, in parliamentary support, capacity building and inclusion of media and civil society in elections related activities;

  • programming of the budget support modalities, development of the EU programming documents such as identification fiches, action documents and all the related annexes, policy analysis;

  • contemporary approaches to democracy, the key challenges and achievements to date;

  • good knowledge of Pakistan political landscape including the functioning of the democratic institutions, the framework in which they operate, the relation between the federal and provincial level, rules, procedures, powers and functions, political parties and of the functioning of the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP);

  • cooperation with donors, international organisations, public administrations and civil society in the sector.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Junior Sectorial Expert -Rule of Law and Fundamental Rights
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The general objective of this mission is to assist the EUD in its IPA II programming support function towards the NIPAC and sector lead institutions with the aim to advance sector-based programming and to systematically improve the quality of related programming documents.

The specific objective is to support the EUD in the review of IPA II sector approach assessment criteria and in the work towards finalisation of related Sector Planning Documents, Sector Approach Roadmaps and Action Documents in line with the established templates.

Expert 3:Junior Sectorial Expert -Rule of Law and Fundamental Rights

Education:

  • at least Master’s Degree Academic level in public administration, political science, law or another field relevant to the assignment.

  • Excellent command of English, both spoken and written;

  • For at least one of the junior experts very good knowledge of Turkish, at a level sufficient to read and analyse strategic documents;

  • Computer literacy (MS Office applications);

  • At least 3 years' experience in working on at least one of the sectors Judiciary, Fundamental Rights and Home Affairs;

  • Previous working experience on assignments in Turkey;

  • Professional experience on sector-based programming of EU assistance is considered an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS
